thread.title: North Andover father accused of assaulting his one-month-old daughter - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: North Andover father accused of assaulting his one-month-old daughter - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: North Andover father accused of assaulting his one-month-old daughter - Massachusetts news
text:
A North Andover father accused of beating his infant daughter pleaded not guilty to the charges against him Thursday, according to the Essex County District Attorney’s Office.
Jamie Fitzgerald, 18, is charged with two counts of assault and battery on a child with substantial injury, authorities said. Fitzgerald, who was indicted on October 15, turned himself in on Thursday and was arraigned in Salem Superior Court, according to the DA’s office.
On August 26, Fitzgerald and his child’s mother took their then one-month-old daughter, who was suffering from injuries from blunt force, to Boston Children’s Hospital, authorities said. The two had initially driven to Lawrence General Hospital, but were told they would have to wait up to five hours for their baby to receive treatment, according to the DA. Lawrence police responded to the scene at Boston Children’s Hospital to investigate the possible child abuse, according to the DA’s office.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Fitzgerald was released Friday and ordered to stay away from his daughter, who is now three months old, authorities said. He is slated to return to court on December 3 for a pre-trail conference.
Fitzgerald’s attorney could not immediately be reached for comment.
